Fdi¶

Overview¶

This module provides the DynamicsProtocol, FDIsystem classes for fdi functionality.

Examples¶

>>> from src.fault_detection.fdi import *

API Summary¶

src.fault_detection.fdi

Detailed API¶

Bases: Protocol

Protocol defining the expected interface for dynamics models.

Advance the system dynamics by one timestep.

__init__(*args, **kwargs)¶
class src.fault_detection.fdi.FDIsystem(residual_threshold=0.5, persistence_counter=10, use_ekf_residual=False, residual_states=<factory>, residual_weights=None, adaptive=False, window_size=50, threshold_factor=3.0, cusum_enabled=False, cusum_threshold=5.0)[source]¶

Bases: object

Lightweight, modular Fault Detection and Isolation (FDI) system with optional adaptive thresholds and CUSUM drift detection.

A residual is formed by comparing the one‑step state prediction from a dynamics model with the actual measurement. If an extended Kalman filter (EKF) is available it may provide a more statistically informed residual (future enhancement). The residual norm is monitored against a threshold; persistent violations indicate a fault.

To improve robustness the detector can adapt its threshold based on recent residual statistics and can optionally employ a cumulative sum (CUSUM) statistic to detect slow drifts. Adaptive thresholding has been shown to enhance the robustness of fault diagnosis by automatically adjusting to operating conditions【218697608892619†L682-L687】. CUSUM methods accumulate deviations from a reference and are sensitive to faint changes【675426604190490†L699-L722】; however the choice of threshold and reference value is critical to avoid false alarms【675426604190490†L746-L752】.

Parameters:

  • residual_threshold (float)

  • persistence_counter (int)

  • use_ekf_residual (bool)

  • residual_states (List[int])

  • residual_weights (List[float] | None)

  • adaptive (bool)

  • window_size (int)

  • threshold_factor (float)

  • cusum_enabled (bool)

  • cusum_threshold (float)

residual_threshold¶

Base threshold for the residual norm. Used when adaptive thresholding is disabled or insufficient samples are available.

Type:

float

persistence_counter¶

Number of consecutive threshold violations required to declare a fault. Helps filter sporadic spikes.

Type:

int

use_ekf_residual¶

Placeholder for future EKF innovation residual.

Type:

bool

residual_states¶

Indices of state variables to include in the residual.

Type:

list[int]

residual_weights¶

Optional weights applied elementwise to the residual before computing the norm.

Type:

list[float], optional

adaptive¶

Enable adaptive thresholding. When True the threshold is computed as mu + threshold_factor * sigma over the last window_size residuals. This dynamic threshold adjusts to changing operating conditions【218697608892619†L682-L687】.

Type:

bool

window_size¶

Number of recent residuals used to estimate the mean and standard deviation for adaptive thresholding.

Type:

int

threshold_factor¶

Multiplicative factor applied to the standard deviation when computing the adaptive threshold. Larger values reduce sensitivity.

Type:

float

cusum_enabled¶

Enable simple CUSUM drift detection. When True the detector accumulates deviations of the residual norm from its running average and compares the sum against cusum_threshold to detect slow drifts【675426604190490†L699-L722】.

Type:

bool

cusum_threshold¶

Threshold for the cumulative sum. When the cumulative sum exceeds this value a fault is declared.

Type:

float

Notes

  • Adaptive thresholding and CUSUM can be enabled independently.

  • When both methods are enabled the residual must exceed either the adaptive threshold persistently or the CUSUM threshold to trigger a fault.

  • The FDI system reports status only (“OK”/”FAULT”) and does not modify the control command path; external supervisors decide safe-state actions. # [CIT-064]

residual_threshold: float = 0.5¶
persistence_counter: int = 10¶
use_ekf_residual: bool = False¶
residual_states: List[int]¶
residual_weights: List[float] | None = None¶
adaptive: bool = False¶
window_size: int = 50¶
threshold_factor: float = 3.0¶
cusum_enabled: bool = False¶
cusum_threshold: float = 5.0¶
tripped_at: float | None = None¶
times: List[float]¶
residuals: List[float]¶
check(t, meas, u, dt, dynamics_model)[source]¶

Check for a fault at the current time step.

Parameters:

  • t (float) – Current simulation time

  • meas (ndarray) – Current state measurement

  • u (float) – Control input applied

  • dt (float) – Time step

  • dynamics_model (DynamicsProtocol) – Model with step(state, u, dt) method for prediction

Returns:

Tuple of (status, residual_norm) where status is “OK” or “FAULT”

Return type:

Tuple[str, float]
